description: A hwRip2DBOverFlow notification signifies that there
has been maximum number of routes added to RIP database for
the given process and no more routes can be added to RIP by
This notification should be generated when the number of routes
added to RIP database reaches maximum value. RIP process will be suspended at this state.

event.Summary: RIP database reached maximum route limit ($v2)

description: The current process id for which processing is being
variables.name: HUAWEI-RIPV2-EXT-MIB::hwRip2CurrentProcId

description: Maximum number of routes that can be added to RIP database.
When this limit is reached, the RIP process will be suspended and hwRip2DBOverFlow notification will be sent.
variables.name: HUAWEI-RIPV2-EXT-MIB::hwRip2DBLimit

description: A hwRip2DBOverFlowResume notification signifies that the RIP database size has dropped to the
lower threshold. RIP process will resume it's normal operation.

event.Summary: RIP database returned to normal operation

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-RIPV2-EXT-MIB::hwRip2DBOverFlowResume HUAWEI-RIPV2-EXT-MIB::hwRip2CurrentProcId i 9999 HUAWEI-RIPV2-EXT-MIB::hwRip2DBLimit u 9999 HUAWEI-RIPV2-EXT-MIB::hwRip2DBThresholdLevel s EXAMPLE

description: The current process id for which processing is being
variables.name: HUAWEI-RIPV2-EXT-MIB::hwRip2CurrentProcId

description: Maximum number of routes that can be added to RIP database.
When this limit is reached, the RIP process will be suspended and hwRip2DBOverFlow notification will be sent.
variables.name: HUAWEI-RIPV2-EXT-MIB::hwRip2DBLimit

description: RIP database threshold value in percentage(%).
This is used only for RIP notifications.
variables.name: HUAWEI-RIPV2-EXT-MIB::hwRip2DBThresholdLevel
